org.jaudiolibs.jnajack
Class JackClient

java.lang.Object
  org.jaudiolibs.jnajack.JackClient

public class JackClient
extends java.lang.Object

Wraps a native Jack client. There is no public constructor - use Jack.getInstance().openClient(...)

Method Detail

registerPort

public JackPort registerPort(java.lang.String name,
                             JackPortType type,
                             java.util.EnumSet<JackPortFlags> flags)
                      throws JackException
Create a new port for the client. This is an object used for moving data of any type in or out of the client. Ports may be connected in various ways. Each port has a short name. The port's full name contains the name of the client concatenated with a colon (:) followed by its short name. The jack_port_name_size() is the maximum length of this full name. Exceeding that will cause the port registration to fail and return NULL. Checking name size is not currently done in JNAJack

Parameters:
name -
type -
flags -
Returns:
JackPort
Throws:
JackException

setProcessCallback

public void setProcessCallback(JackProcessCallback callback)
                        throws JackException
Tell the Jack server to call the JackProcessCallback whenever there is work be done. The code in the supplied function must be suitable for real-time execution. That means that it cannot call functions that might block for a long time.

Parameters:
callback -
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException

onShutdown

public void onShutdown(JackShutdownCallback callback)
                throws JackException
Register a function (and argument) to be called if and when the JACK server shuts down the client thread. The function is not called on the process thread --- use only async-safe functions, and remember that it is executed from another thread. A typical function might set a flag or write to a pipe so that the rest of the application knows that the JACK client thread has shut down. NOTE: clients do not need to call this. It exists only to help more complex clients understand what is going on. It should be called before activate().

Parameters:
callback -
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException

activate

public void activate()
              throws JackException
Tell the Jack server that the program is ready to start processing audio.

Throws:
JackException - if client could not be activated.

deactivate

public void deactivate()
Tell the JACK server to remove this client from the process graph. Also, disconnect all ports belonging to it, since inactive clients have no port connections.

close

public void close()
Disconnects this client from the JACK server.

public java.lang.String getName()

public int getSampleRate()
                  throws JackException
Get the sample rate of the jack system, as set by the user when jackd was started.

Returns:
sample rate
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException

getBufferSize

public int getBufferSize()
                  throws JackException
The current maximum size that will ever be passed to the JackProcessCallback. It should only be used *before* the client has been activated. This size may change, clients that depend on it must register a JackBuffersizeCallback so they will be notified if it does.

Returns:
int maximum buffersize.
Throws:
net.neilcsmith.jnajack.JackException
JackException
